snippet: Reform proposals in Europe, Britain and the United States could make banks safer. The banks will resist them, but policy makers should respond by making them tougher, not weaker.
abstract: Editorial contends new report by European Commission-approved committee of experts makes strong case for having large banks segregate traditional banking activities from risky trading operations; asserts that bloc-wide action could shore up efforts for reforms in US and hopefully lead to global regulation.
lead_paragraph: Reform proposals in Europe, Britain and the United States could make banks safer. The banks will resist them, but policy makers should respond by making them tougher, not weaker.
